intro: Aristida necopina, commonly known as the narrowleaf threeawn, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces pale green to brownish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Aristida necopina is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments with minimal water.
